item.title: Anyone Interested In Making Organizational Changes Should Read This Book
item.description: If you are at all interested in making organizational changes, then you need to clear your calendar and read: “Switch: How to Change Things When Change Is Hard” by Dan Heath and Chip Heath. And here’s why: Reason #1: True operational excellence is within the reach of anyone willing to address real issues. You don’t have to be in “top management” to make changes, but you do need to work harder and more explicitly.
